metadata.title: How to Set Up YouTube Merch Shelf 2025: Sell Products on Videos
metadata.description: Enable YouTube merch shelf. Display products directly on your videos.

hero.headline: How to Set Up YouTube Merch Shelf
hero.subheadline: Sell merchandise directly from your videos.

sections.content: The merch shelf displays your products directly below videos, making it easy for fans to buy without leaving YouTube. Once you're eligible and connected to a merch partner, products appear automatically on relevant videos. Here's how to set it up and maximize merch sales.

sections.title: Setting Up Merch Shelf
content: Choose approved merch partner (Spreadshop, Teespring, etc.)
Customize which products show on which videos

faq.question: How much can you make from merch?
faq.answer: Varies wildly—depends on audience size, engagement, and product relevance. Profit margins typically 20-40% per item. Some creators earn more from merch than ads. Start small, test what sells.

faq.question: Best products for YouTube merch?
faq.answer: T-shirts most common and expected. Hoodies higher profit margin. Mugs, stickers for lower price points. Inside jokes and catchphrases perform well. Quality matters for repeat customers.

faq.question: Can I use my own merch store?
faq.answer: Merch shelf requires approved partners only. You can still link to external stores in descriptions and pinned comments. Some creators use both—shelf for convenience, external for full catalog.

faq.question: Why isn't merch shelf showing?
faq.answer: Check eligibility requirements met. Ensure products approved and published. Some videos may not show shelf based on content. Feature can take time to activate after setup.
